main_definition: Designated or assigned to a particular role, task, or position.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Set aside for a specific purpose or use.
meanings_and_examples.example: The council appointed a new member to join their team.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Assigning someone to an official position, role or task.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was appointed as the head of the department.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Designating someone for a specific purpose or duty temporarily.
meanings_and_examples.example: The president appointed an ambassador to represent them in the international conference.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Decided upon as suitable for a particular task by an authority or committee.
meanings_and_examples.example: They appointed her as the team leader due to her excellent leadership skills.
